hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Regulatory News Mispricing
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, negative regulatory news (FCA, MiCA, etc.) causing >6% BTC drop within 24 hours that fully retraces within next 48 hours on below-average volume indicates bear trap and high-probability transition to BULL regime within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Markets often overreact to regulatory news in neutral environments. Rapid, low-volume recovery suggests weak selling conviction and absorption by larger buyers. Failed breakdowns frequently precede bullish momentum as trapped shorts cover.
entry_conditions: Negative regulatory headline triggers >6% BTC decline in 24h
Full retracement of news-driven drop within 48 hours
BTC holds above pre-news low for 24h after retracement

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to BULL (confirmed) or 12% gain
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit after 7 days if no BULL regime confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >60% of such rapid recoveries lead to new lows within 5 days (recovery is dead cat bounce, not regime transition).
